org.modelio.vcore.smkernel.mapi

Interface MMetamodel


  • public interface MMetamodel
    MMetamodel represent the so-called 'runtime metamodel' used by Modelio kernel at run time.

    Note the Modelio kernel does not know anything about how to load the metamodel. Practically, MMetamodel is only a repository for known MClass instances.

    Since:
    Modelio 3.4

    • Method Detail

      • getMClass

        MClass getMClass(java.lang.Class<? extends MObject> interf)
        Get a meta class by its java interface

        The meta class must be passed as an Java class defining the meta class structure.

        Parameters:
        interf - a metaclass java interface.
        Returns:
        the meta class corresponding to the 'interf' Java interface class, null if it cannot be found

      • getMClass

        MClass getMClass(java.lang.String name)
        Get a meta class by its name or its qualified name .
        Parameters:
        name - the metaclass name.
        Returns:
        the meta class named 'name', null if it does not exist.

      • getRegisteredMClasses

        java.util.Collection<? extends MClass> getRegisteredMClasses()
        Get all the metamodel classes.
        Returns:
        the metamodel classes.

      • getMExpert

        MExpert getMExpert()
        Get the metamodel expert, relying on experts provided by each metamodel fragment.
        Returns:
        the metamodel expert.

      • getFragments

        java.util.Collection<? extends MMetamodelFragment> getFragments()
        Get the registered metamodel fragments.

        The returned list is not modifiable.

        Returns:
        the metamodel fragments.

      • getFragments

        java.util.Collection<org.modelio.vcore.smkernel.meta.ISmMetamodelFragment> getFragments(boolean withFakes)
        Get the registered metamodel fragments with and fake fragments if asked.

        The returned list is not modifiable.

        Parameters:
        withFakes - if true the returned collection also contains fake metamodel fragments.
        Returns:
        the requested metamodel fragments.

      • getSortedFragments

        java.util.List<? extends MMetamodelFragment> getSortedFragments()
                                                         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Get the registered fragments sorted by dependencies.

        The first fragment needs nobody.

        Returns:
        the sorted metamodel fragments.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there is a cycle in the metamodel fragment dependencies
        Since:
        3.6
